repnme.cdata!: Nepal - Second and Third Telecommunications Projects

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second and Third Telecommunications
            Projects in Nepal was satisfactory. The International
            Development Association (IDA) must be commended for its
            significant contribution to the sector outside the two
            projects through its assistance and support to the Nepal
            Telecommunications Corporation (NTC) in resisting a proposal
            by a well known private telecommunications operating company
            for take over of international telecommunications operations
            in Nepal from NTC. The completion of both projects was
            substantially delayed by about four years. In general, the
            two projects achieved the basic objective of establishing an
            integrated modern telecommunications network in Nepal on
            which NTC could further develop adequate and efficient
            telecommunications services to meet the national needs, both
            for the "plain old telephone service" for the
            general public and enhanced voice and non voice services by
            its business and government customers.

docna.cdata!:
Nepal - Third Telecommunications Project :
            Credit 0799 - Development Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Nepal - Third Telecommunications
            Project : Credit 0799 - Development Credit Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Telecommunications Project is
            designed to extend existing facilities so as to enable about
            70% of the demand for local telephone service to be met; it
            will extend the long distance network to areas presently
            without service, provide long distance dialing and open up
            exchange service at 21 new locations; it also provides for
            subscribers radio facilities at 100 isolated locations
            (mainly community centers), will expand telex facilities to
            meet demand for most of the country and provide a small
            satellite earth station to improve and expand international
            telecommunication facilities. Provision has been made for
            technical assistance in project implementation and training.
            The project faces no special risks beyond those commonly
            associated with telecommunications projects.
